main event: An unidentified round object, about the size of a marble held at arm's length and making no sound, was observed in Brooksville, Florida on May 18, 1956 for approximately 2 minutes.
interesting points: The object was observed to be silver in color and of comparable size to a marble at arm's length.
There were no photographs of the object, but it was described to exhibit tail characteristics.
No radar report was made, and it was concluded that the object was likely a balloon or possibly an astronomical body like the star Spica.
The location and time of the sighting corresponded with characteristics of an astronomical body rising to position over-head in 2 minutes.
The observer, identified as a housewife in Brooksville, Florida, reported clear and unlimited visibility during the sighting.
